metadata.title: CVE-2024-43866 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/mlx5: Always drain health in shutdown callbackThere is no point in recovery during device shutdown. if healthwork started need to wait for it to avoid races and NULL pointeraccess.Hence, drain health WQ on shutdown callback.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
